      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void doKey(java.lang.String key)
      Respond to key actions
      void doLoad()
      Load a grid of cells (and Worker position) for the current level from a file
      void drawWarehouse()
      Draw the grid of cells on the screen, and the Worker
      boolean isSolved()
      Returns true if the warehouse is solved, i.e., all the shelves have boxes on them
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args) 
      void move(java.lang.String direction)
      Moves the worker into the new position (guaranteed to be empty)
      void moveOrPush(java.lang.String direction)
      Moves the worker in the given direction, if possible.
      java.lang.String opposite(java.lang.String direction)
      Returns the direction that is opposite of the parameter useful for undoing!
      void pull(boolean push, java.lang.String direction)
      Pull: (could be useful for undoing a push) move the Worker in the direction, pull the box into the Worker's old position
      void push(java.lang.String direction)
      Push: Moves the Worker, pushing the box one step
      void redo() 
      void reportWin()
      Report a win by flickering the cells with boxes
      void setupGUI()
      Add the buttons and set the key listener.
      void undo()

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)

      • move

        public void move(java.lang.String direction)
        Moves the worker into the new position (guaranteed to be empty)
        Parameters:
        direction - the direction the worker is heading

      • moveOrPush

        public void moveOrPush(java.lang.String direction)
        Moves the worker in the given direction, if possible. If there is box in front of the Worker and a space in front of the box, then push the box. Otherwise, if the worker can't move, do nothing.

      • opposite

        public java.lang.String opposite(java.lang.String direction)
        Returns the direction that is opposite of the parameter useful for undoing!

      • pull

        public void pull(boolean push,
                 java.lang.String direction)
        Pull: (could be useful for undoing a push) move the Worker in the direction, pull the box into the Worker's old position

      • push

        public void push(java.lang.String direction)
        Push: Moves the Worker, pushing the box one step
        Parameters:
        direction - the direction the worker is heading

        public void redo()

      • reportWin

        public void reportWin()
        Report a win by flickering the cells with boxes

        public void setupGUI()
        Add the buttons and set the key listener.
